title: Adonai Martínez
text:
Adonai Ulises Martínez Bonilla (born October 3, 1975) is a retired professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player from <a href="El%20Salvador">El Salvador</a>.
Club career.
He started his professional career at <a href="Alianza%20F.C.">Alianza</a> with whom he won two league titles including the 2001 Apertura after scoring one of the goals in the 2-1 Final win against <a href="C.D.%20Luis%20%C3%81ngel%20Firpo">Luis Ángel Firpo</a>. In 2003, he had a short spell at <a href="C.D.%20Chalatenango">Chalatenango</a> before joining <a href="C.D.%20Luis%20%C3%81ngel%20Firpo">Luis Ángel Firpo</a>. He then moved to <a href="A.D.%20Isidro%20Metap%C3%A1n">Isidro Metapán</a> and <a href="San%20Salvador%20F.C.">San Salvador</a> before another two years at <a href="Once%20Municipal">Once Municipal</a>.
On March 31, 2006, he scored his 100th goal in the <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20de%20El%20Salvador">Primera División de Fútbol de El Salvador</a> after scoring two goals against Águila.
International career.
Martínez made his debut for <a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador</a> in a March <a href="1999%20UNCAF%20Nations%20Cup">1999 UNCAF Nations Cup</a> match against <a href="Guatemala%20national%20football%20team">Guatemala</a> and has earned a total of 21 caps, scoring no goals. He has represented his country in 5 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> matches and played at the <a href="1999%20UNCAF%20Nations%20Cup">1999 UNCAF Nations Cup</a> as well as at the <a href="2002%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">2002 CONCACAF Gold Cup</a>.
His final international game was a March 2004 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a>, also against <a href="Guatemala%20national%20football%20team">Guatemala</a>.
Personal life.
He became father of his first child at the young age of 19.
